section.title: Upgrading SciDB
section.para:

upgrading

SciDB This section describes how to upgrade your version of SciDB. For this section, we use the following conventions:
To represent your current version: scidbOldVersion.
To represent the new version that you are installing: scidbNewVersion.
If you are upgrading from a previous version of SciDB, make sure to perform the following tasks:

step.para:
Backup your data. The recommended way to do this is to use opaque save. You need to repeat the procedure for each of your arrays. You should also note the schema for each array.
Use opaque save to save your first array.AQL% SAVE array-name INTO 'saved_array' AS 'OPAQUE'This saves the array data to saved_array to the coordinator instance, under your SciDB base path folder. Repeat this for each of your arrays. For details, see .
Note the schema for each of your arrays. You can use list('arrays') to get a list of your arrays and their schemas.AFL% list('arrays');
After saving, you should copy all the array files to a temporary folder. This ensures that the data will be available, even if you need to restore to change your database name or configuration of your SciDB instances.
When saving arrays in this manner, only the latest version of the array is saved.
Stop SciDB, if it is running. From the SciDB user account, run the following command, where myDataBase is the name of your database:scidb.py stopall myDataBase
If you want to keep your current SciDB configuration file, make a backup copy of it somewhere. By default, the file is in the following location:

OPTIONAL. You can run multiple versions of SciDB, if you would like. However, you can remove the previous version of SciDB if you only need to run the latest version of SciDB. If you installed to the default location, run the following command to remove the old version:sudo rm -Rf /opt/scidb/scidbOldVersion/For example, if your current version is 12.10, the above command removes the /opt/scidb/12.10 folder and all of its sub folders.
To continue the upgrade process, proceed to to install the latest packages.

Update your environment variables to refer to the new version of SciDB. Make sure to change your SciDB Version variable from its current value to the scidbNewVersion. Old version:export SCIDB_VER=scidbOldVersion # This should be set in your environment.Set to new version:export SCIDB_VER=scidbNewVersionFor details, see .

listitem.para: If you copied your existing config.ini file: make sure to change all occurrences of scidbOldVersionto scidbNewVersion. After you edit the file, copy it to the /opt/scidb/scidbNewVersion/etc/folder.
For example, if you are upgrading to version is &scidb_version;, you would copy your file to the /opt/scidb/&scidb_version;/etc/ folder.
If you want to set up and use a new config.ini file: Proceed to .

step.para: Initialize and restart your SciDB database. Initialization is necessary to avoid errors that you would otherwise receive, based on incompatibilities between your your "old" database and your "new" SciDB version.
After you have the new version of SciDB running, restore the data that you saved in step 1. For details, see .

note.para: Utilities from different versions of SciDB are not inter-operable. For example, a &scidb_version; client cannot be used with a 13.1 SciDB server.
